image.altText: Photos of the underside of a Baby Maugean skates in a tank

props.synopsis: From a specimen unexpectedly launching itself out of a tank, to another dying from a gastrointestinal blockage, and bite marks made during mating rituals, the ABC can reveal the challenges scientist face keeping the endangered Maugean skate species alive.

image.altText: Man with Tasmanian giant freshwater crayfish.

props.synopsis: A creek in northern Tasmanian known to be home to the endangered giant freshwater crayfish has sustained "serious environmental harm" from land clearing and earthworks, the Environment Protection Agency has advised.

title.children: Unauthorised land clearing impacted endangered crayfish, EPA finds

image.altText: The ChatGPT app icon on a mobile phone screen.

props.synopsis: When Georgina Doll was looking to buy a home, generative artificial intelligence was one of the sources she turned to for advice.

title.children: AI 'often gets figures wrong', financial adviser warns

image.altText: A drone view of school buildings surrounded by suburban streets.

props.synopsis: The non-teaching member of staff at the Friends' School was arrested and charged following two police raids in Hobart.

title.children: Hobart private school staff member charged with child abuse offence

image.altText: A picture of three metal raised garden beds, and in the background several people are tending to plants

props.synopsis: The Bucaan Community House in Chigwell has put its community garden activities on hold due to a lack of funding.

image.altText: Hobart Clinic closure  2025-09-17 10:09:00

props.synopsis: The new board has formally accepted a one-off $2 million funding offer from the Tasmanian government as it prepares to reopen the private mental health hospital.

image.altText: A man in tan suit, glasses, grey hair and beard speaks into mic with supporters wearing 'peter george' t-shirts behind him

props.synopsis: A $100,000 donation from a sole donor was one of 212 declared by anti-salmon campaigner Peter George in his federal politics tilt, newly released Australian Electoral Commission returns show.

title.children: $100k from sole donor helped fund Peter George campaign, AEC returns show

image.altText: Bulldozer clears ground next to bushfire flames.

props.synopsis: Two bushfire emergency warnings for Nugent in south-east Tasmania have been downgraded, with residents told they can "return with caution".

title.children: Bushfire concerns for communities in south-east Tasmania ease

image.altText: kevin rudd stands under a circular light that looks like a halo

props.synopsis: From his humble early days as a child reading Hansard in the regional Sunshine State pocket of Eumundi, Kevin Rudd has been preparing for this martyrdom. But the Passion Of The Kevin, when it came, was a million miles from home.Â

image.altText: The outside of an aircraft printed with the letters REX in blue and orange

props.synopsis: Regional Express Airlines has found a buyer after the company went into voluntary administration last July.

title.children: Rex Airlines finds US buyer after voluntary administration

image.altText: Logan Hospital entrance and signage, south of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: A public health probe has so far failed to identify the source of the poisonings, which authorities say aren't being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Police working with health authorities after five people ingest rat poison

image.altText: Two cabinets at the centre of the gallery are highlighted.

props.synopsis: As French authorities scour Europe for some of their nation's most prized possessions, closer inspection of the Louvre museum itself reveals just how vulnerable it was to the type of attack that saw some of the French crown jewels disappear.

title.children: Power tools and a 'perfect storm': How France lost its treasure

image.altText: A woman in a blue suit laughs as she speaks into a microphone with a Japanese flag behind her.

props.synopsis: In the world of male-dominated politics, Sanae Takaichi has broken through an incredibly tough glass ceiling.

title.children: Japan may have its first female PM, but some say it is not a win for women

image.altText: A woman in a red dress walking to court as cameramen take photos of her.

title.children: Senator Nampijinpa Price civil trial hears CEO's reputation 'hit' after media coverage

image.altText: man with jaw length curly hair, mustache and goatee wearing red hoodie leans against a fence separating seats from a footy oval.

props.synopsis: Proud Gamilaroi man and TV presenter Tony Armstrong has felt the sting of racist trolling online. Now he's using it as ammunition as he tackles racism in sport in the new documentary series End Game.

image.altText: Nicolas Sarkozy waves to the crowd, walking next to wife Carla Bruni.

image.altText: A wooden table and bench in front of an outback pub.

image.altText: Australian cricket captain Alyssa Healy speaks to players before a game, with the shot taken from outside the huddle.

title.children: Ancient Australia mapped: What Deep Time stories are near you?

image.altText: A blonde, middle-aged woman stands outdoors and speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: The late Virginia Giuffre's memoir details how she became involved in the shadowy world of notorious sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, which led to her abuse at the hands of some of the world's "wealthiest and most powerful" people.

title.children: Giuffre haunted by 'hungry ghosts' of Epstein and Maxwell, memoir says

image.altText: Blue, pink and grey plastic-looking guns and parts

props.synopsis: An Australian Border Force operation leads to the seizure of more than 1,000 firearms and parts, including 281 made via 3D-printing processes.

title.children: Border Force cracks down on 3D-printed guns and parts

image.altText: Woman with dark brown hair and white shirt smiles

props.synopsis: Jason Thomas King has been sentenced to life in prison after being found guilty of beating 74-year-old Susan Walker to death at her Gold Coast home, where he rented a room.

title.children: Man found guilty of brutal murder of Gold Coast landlord

image.altText: Two men with guns surrounded by cardboard boxes.

props.synopsis: The military raided KK Park which is a well-documented cybercrime centre as part of its operations to suppress crimes like online fraud.

title.children: Myanmar military shuts down major online scam operation detaining 2,000 people

image.altText: Tess Craven of the Kangaroos attempts to take a mark.

props.synopsis: One of the biggest challenges the AFLW faces is end-of-year "footy fatigue", according to diehard fans and industry insiders.

title.children: 'Footy fatigue' leaves AFLW struggling for attention after men's season

image.altText: Australia's four-woman rowing team at the Paris Olympic Games in 2024

props.synopsis: Despite backlash from national and international bodies, Rockhampton's Fitzroy River receives positive feedback following initial water testing to prove it is up to standard to host rowing and canoeing events for the Brisbane Games.

title.children: Controversial river gets first green light to host 2032 Olympic events

image.altText: Mental Health Public Entry sign.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest will be held into a "cluster" of three patient suicides inside the secure mental health wards of a major Brisbane hospital within just seven months.

title.children: Three patient suicides inside Brisbane mental health wards to be investigated

image.altText: A photo of a man with red hair in a blue t-shirt looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A magistrate rejects an application by an accused rapist to prevent media from reporting on his alleged links with accused paedophile childcare worker Joshua Dale Brown.

title.children: Accused sex offender Michael Wilson fails in media suppression bid

image.altText: Australian bowler Scott Boland smiles into the camera as he stands talking to the media at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Australian Test paceman Scott Boland says his five-wicket spell for Victoria last Friday was important for his confidence ahead of the Ashes.

title.children: 'It's ... a stepping stone': Top Shield spell boosts Boland for Ashes

image.altText: A crocodile in a resort pool.

props.synopsis: A young female crocodile is transported to a nearby wildlife park after causing a stir with a dip in a resort pool.

title.children: Crocodile relocated after being found in Port Douglas resort pool

image.altText: a man touching green weeds

props.synopsis: A Lockyer Valley man has accidentally found a toxic weed not seen in the region for more than half a century.

title.children: One of Australia's worst weeds unearthed in Australia's 'salad bowl'

image.altText: A man plays in a sandpit with his four children.

props.synopsis: Homeschooling rates are rising rapidly, with families claiming schools aren't coping with bullying or neurodiversity.

title.children: 'Accidental' homeschooling grows, as families blame struggling schools

image.altText: A man in a top hat and a coat points a stick at an enormous rectangular-shaped ox with curved horns

props.synopsis: An oil painting of an enormous cow is the star attraction at a regional Australian gallery. How did the genre of massive livestock art become so popular?

title.children: The hidden story behind this painting of a huge bull
